conclusion: Analyze the area under the velocity-time graph for each object to determine when they are farthest apart.
Object A's graph shows a decreasing velocity from \( v_0 \) to 0.
Object B's graph shows an increasing velocity from 0 to \( v_0 \).
For Object A, the displacement is the area under the curve from \( t = 0 \) to \( t = t_2 \).
For Object B, the displacement is the area under the curve from \( t = 0 \) to \( t = t_2 \).
The maximum separation occurs when the difference in the areas under the curves is the greatest.
At \( t = t_2 \), Object A has reached its maximum displacement, and Object B has just started moving.
The two objects are farthest apart at \( t = t_2 \).
